clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of n-3 PUFA From Fish in Enteral Nutrition of Major Burn Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Omega-3 PUFA From Fish in Major Burn Patients. EFECTO DE ÁCIDOS GRASOS POLIINSATURADOS OMEGA 3 DERIVADOS DE ACEITE DE PESCADO, EN QUEMADOS GRAVES

brief_summary.textblock:
Studies have shown that burn patients may benefit from low fat diets, but there is still no strong data regarding the impact of fatty acid composition used for feeding. The trial test the hypothesis that the inclusion of omega-3 PUFA in a low fat diet may improve outcome. Prospective randomised controlled trial in adult patients admitted for burns > 15% body surface area (BSA), and inhalation injury requiring mechanical ventilation and enteral nutrition. On admission randomization to receive a low-fat (18% energy as fat) modular enteral diet (LF-EN) and identical with the half of fat provided by fish oil (FO-EN). Study endpoints: mechanical ventilation time, inflammation (CRP), infectious and other complications, mortality until discharge.
The study is planed as 2 parts: 1) preliminary study testing the feasibility of the study, 2) the study completed with information from the preliminary phase, both phases being randomised and controlled.

detailed_description.textblock:
Randomisation within the first 24 hours of admission to 2 types of enteral feeds: 1) ω 3 PUFA (FO-EN) or 2) control solution which is the hospitals standard low 18% fat containing solution.
The patients are fed as long as clinically required with the initial solution.

primary_outcome.time_frame: up to Day 28 after burn injury
primary_outcome.description: Infectious complications will be recorded according to CDC criteria, and grouped as pulmonary, blood stream infections (catheter related or not), cutaneous, abdominal and others

secondary_outcome.description: Any complication will be recorded during the above time frame

other_outcome.description: Time on mechanical ventilation though an endotracheal tube (naso-tracheal or tracheostomy)

other_outcome.measure: Length of ICU and hospital stay
other_outcome.description: ICU and hospital to discharge but maximum for 28 days

other_outcome.time_frame: during ICU stay and up to day 28
other_outcome.description: C-reactive protein as determined for clinical purpose, Temperature (maximal T° per day), Leucocytes

arm_group.description: Modular low fat diet (18%) including 9% as ω-3 PUFA

intervention.description: The patients are fed as long as the clinically required with the randomly attributed enteral solution.
intervention.other_name: modular preparation: 9% ω-3 of the total 18% fat

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- adult >16 years, burns > 15% BSA, mechanical ventilation, next of kin consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- absence of the above, absence of commitment to full treatment
- comorbidities (cancer, COPD, diabetes, liver failure (Child Pugh B and C)
- pregnancy
